channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2024010016
item.description:
Report X-2024010016

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING CLEAN UP AND INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED PACKAGE CONTAINED 4 4LITER GLASS BOTTLES OF HEXANE IN WHICH 1 BOTTLE CRACKED AT THE TOP. THE REMAINING BOTTLES WERE CONTAMINATED, ENTIRE CONTENTS GOT PROCESSED THRU DMP.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap loosened and caused the contents to spill out and leaked in the box that lead to the box breaking. DescribePack: the caps weren't tightened correctly DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: we moved the hazardus material to our hazmat cage away from being able to harm anyone and put the contents in a drum so it didn't get all over while we wait to process this report.

item.title: Report E-2023120438
item.description:
Report E-2023120438

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: BARRY
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DYNO NOBEL TRANSPORTATION, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 11/30/2023, 45,660 pounds of Ammonium Nitrate Emulsion (ANE) was loaded into trailer 974 through the rearmost hatch. After loading was completed, the rear hatch was not closed and latched by the loader. On 12/1/2023, the driver coupled to the trailer and departed Barry, IL and drove to Buckley Powder Company in Hermann, MO. The driver arrived, unloaded into the product tower, and traveled back in reverse order on the same route. The trailer was uncoupled Barry, IL. Employees at site observed ANE residue on the side of the trailer. Buckley Powder Company found spots of ANE residue on their private gravel road totaling less than ten (10) pounds, which they cleaned up and disposed of properly. It is estimated 5,247 pounds of ANE was lost in transit between Barry, IL and Hermann, MO. It was raining on 12/1/2023. Dyno Nobel employees inspected the roadways of IL 106 and US 54 and there was not any evidence of residue on the roadway. The Buckley Powder manager inspected Loutre Bend Rd and did not observe residue on the road.

item.title: Report E-2023120444
item.description:
Report E-2023120444

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 15, 2023, eleven (11) 44-pound bags of UN3077 were damaged in transit and released approximately 120-pounds of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ to remediate the impacted site. ES+ personnel utilized absorbents, hand tools, and a vacuum unit to remediate the impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023120415
item.description:
Report E-2023120415

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 15, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon jerrican of UN3109 was crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbent to the pallet area and trailer floor, working them in with hand tools. Crews utilizing a degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. All UN3109 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon ventilated drum. The damaged 5-gallon jerrican of UN3109 was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon ventilated drum for disposal by R+L.

item.description:
Report X-2023120953

  • City: CHAMPAIGN

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking and placed into haz bag and tote. Tote was brought to a QA area. DescribePack: 2 paint cans dented on body and 1 rim. Cans had no paint clips and 1 lid popped off resulting in leakage. 2nd can soiled from leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a haz bag and tote. Tote was brought to a QA area.

item.title: Report X-2023120948
item.description:
Report X-2023120948

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-17
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The flammable liquid marked package was processed at the pickup station. Steel drum was discovered in a tote stained on the outside of the drum. Further inspection of the package confirmed there is a dent around the neck of the drum which is causing liquid to release out of the drum while being moved. DescribePack: Appears a dent on the can has not exposed the contents completely but is causing release from inside due to the structural damage to the drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside a tote to maintain release of flammable liquid.

item.title: Report X-2023121043
item.description:
Report X-2023121043

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00
